Class TaskService

java.lang.Object
com.example.examplefeature.TaskService
@Service public class TaskService extends Object
Service class that handles business logic related to Task entities.

This service provides methods for creating and retrieving tasks from the persistence layer through the TaskRepository.

All public methods are transactional, ensuring proper database consistency.

  • Method Details

    • createTask

      @Transactional public void createTask(String description, @Nullable LocalDate dueDate)
      Creates and persists a new Task.

      The creation date is automatically set to the current system time. The due date may be null if no deadline is specified.

      This method runs within a transactional context and immediately flushes the entity to the database after persisting.

      Parameters:
      description - the description of the task; must not be null or empty
      dueDate - the optional due date of the task; may be null
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the description equals "fail" (used for testing error handling)

    • list

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public List<Task> list(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Retrieves a paginated list of Task entities.

      This method executes in a read-only transactional context to ensure that no data modifications occur during retrieval.

      Parameters:
      pageable - the pagination and sorting information; must not be null
      Returns:
      a list of tasks corresponding to the given page request
